primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: Introduction to film form (including style and narration), different types of films, and popular approaches to the study of cinema. Topics include: narrative cinema, documentary, avant-garde, genre, authorship, ideology, and representation.
cmCourseInfo.title: Introduction to Film Study

primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: Introduction to the study of new and contemporary media forms, with a focus on aesthetic and moving-image media. Students will learn key concepts in digital media studies through close examination of historical and contemporary examples from art, cinema, video, and games. Course readings draw on interdisciplinary critical models from cinema studies, cultural studies, art history, and digital media studies.
cmCourseInfo.title: New Media Forms

primaryOrg.name: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

cmCourseInfo.description: Course on special topics in Cinema Studies. Topics vary each year.
cmCourseInfo.title: Special Topics in Cinema Studies

cmCourseInfo.description: The course may have a historical, genre, theoretical, auteur, or other focus. Students should contact the program director for the current topic. [24L, 36P]
cmCourseInfo.title: Topics in Cinema Studies
cmCourseInfo.recommendedPreparation: (CIN101H5 or CIN202H5) or at least 1.0 credits in courses that count toward Cinema Studies programs.

cmCourseInfo.description: Courses in special topics designed for Specialists and Majors in Cinema Studies.
cmCourseInfo.title: Special Topics in Theory and Criticism II

cmCourseInfo.description: Independent research projects devised by students and supervised by Cinema Studies faculty. Open to advanced Specialist and Major students in the Program. Submit applications to the Cinema Studies Undergraduate Office prior to requesting enrolment: Fall term courses, June 1/ Winter term courses, November 1/ Summer term courses, April 1. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
cmCourseInfo.title: Independent Studies in Cinema
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: At least 10.0 credits, including CIN105Y1, CIN201Y1, CIN301Y1
